comments.author: anon
comments.body:
Good article!

The misunderstanding of OO historically started with language designers themselves, who came up with implementation instead of interface inheritance in Simula 67.

The rigid coupling introduced by implementation inheritance got OO started wrong-footed, and turned it into its polar opposite. It is nearly impossible to get this out of people's minds today, although we now know better.

OO is all about the *decoupling* of source code. This is what the SOLID principles and the Gang of Four advice are really about!
